result.execSummary:
The defendant John R. Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John R. Martin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John R. Martin was found guilty of Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 9 months in the county jail w/huber privileges - Stayed.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Not to drive without being adequately licensed.  Not to get car keys back from girlfriend until licensed.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: Original sentence changed - see below per 10/26/17 order of judge- Amendment #2.
AS A CONDITION OF PROBATION Deft is to serve conditional jail until the probation discharge date of 4/13/18 with credit since the 9/28/17 Order to Detain.  Huber privileges are allowed.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  State files amended information.  Atty Watson acknowledges receipt and waives reading.  On State's motion, cts 2, 3 & 4 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; 9 months conditional jail w/Huber privileges is stayed; credit for 5 days served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs, any remainder of bond to be returned to poster.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 4/13/16 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.
Kristyne Watson  kmk

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty K Watson appeared, for Atty A Rufo, on behalf of deft, who did not appear.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Watson states the deft called the office this week and was informed that Atty Rufo is out sick, unknown if that is why he fails to appear.  FPT continued to 3/23/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney R DeFilippis.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty DeFilippis states that Atty Rufo is being appointed on this case.  FPT continued to 3/4/16 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
Andrea Rufo  kmk
